attributes.action: reduce the tax on fuel to rural and island communities
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
These communities are vital - do we want to import meat/poultry from abroad - we will if the farmers and country folk aren't supported. Here in Shetland the diesel now costs £1.42 a litre. People can't afford to get to work. We are flying off the island to Dublin - this involves 3 flights because our flight booked back in October was cancelled. We face £120 fuel surcharge just to fly to Dublin for my daughter's wedding. It is now £520 to get from Shetland to Dublin. Food prices have rocketed with average loaf of bread £1 and a lettuce £1. The emphasise is on healthy eating but now fruit and veggies are rocketing out of the price of people. 

Crime - we moved here because of the crime on the mainland - there needs to be a zero tolerance approach - and strict immigration on the E8

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
